author: R Sivaraman
text:
Police have prohibited holding of processions, demonstrations and public meetings which have not been granted special exemption.

Senior Superintendent of Police V.J.Chandran said, “No person or class of persons shall convene or collect as an assembly or form or take out any procession or stage any public demonstration/ picketing on any road or street or thoroughfare or hold public meeting in Puducherry District for a period of 30 days from March 15 to April 13 except under and in accordance with the terms and conditions of licence issued by District Collector, Puducherry, and the regional administrators concerned in respect of Mahe and Yanam Regions.”

He also stated that those who want conduct such demonstration, procession or public meeting should apply to District Collector in respect of Puducherry region and Regional Administrators concerned in respect of Mahe and Yanam regions for licence at least 48 hours in advance.

In a notification, the Senior Superintendent of Police (Law and Order), Puducherry, said he passed the order after having satisfied that there is likelihood of breach of peace in Puducherry district, owing to the proposed agitations/ demonstrations by various political parties/ organisations/ associations, which may cause dislocation to traffic, danger to the community and damage/loss to private and public properties and also disturbance to public order.

The order shall not affect marriages, religious and funeral procession and government functions, clarified Mr. Chandran.
title: Ban on demonstrations, public meetings
